text: Viking’s accidentally made a rudimentary form of steel when they tried to fuse the spirit of an animal or ancestor into a weapon. They would crush bones and fuse it into iron when forging weapons. – fact51

The otherwise adorable duck-billed platypus (Ornithorhynchus anatinus) has a venomous spur on its hind legs. The spur is only on the males and is non-lethal to humans but can be extremely painful. – fact51

Joseph “Moondyne Joe” Johns escaped prison so often that a special prison was built for him. The jailer was so confident in the new jail he promised to set Joe free if he ever escaped. Joe escaped and was caught 2 years later, but the jailer kept his word and freed him. – fact51
Sgriob is a Gaelic word meaning “an itching of the lip, superstitiously supposed to precede a feast, a drink of whiskey, or a kiss from a favorite.” – fact51 Source: https://katexic.com/word/sgriob/
The tomato frog’s defense mechanism is to secrete a glue that ultimately causes their predators lips to stick together.
A 2009 study found that the closer a woman lives to the equator, the more likely she is to give birth to a female.
A family taking a walk on a beach in Wales found a message in a bottle thrown into the ocean by a German couple 1,624 miles away and nearly four years earlier. – fact51

In 1922, Ernest Hemingway’s wife Elizabeth lost all but two of his early manuscripts while traveling by train from Paris to Switzerland to meet Hemingway. They’ve never been found.
– fact51

Caffeine extracted from coffee beans to make decaf coffee is sold as crude caffeine to refiners and the pure caffeine is ultimately sold to soft drink makers like Coca Cola and Pepsi. – fact51Source: https://www.npr.org/sections/thesalt/2016/02/26/467844829/inside-the-anonymous-world-of-caffeine?t=1561060551334

Estádio Milton Corrêa, or Zerão, is a multi-purpose stadium in Northern Brazil situated near the equator or zero degrees latitude and thus has one end in the Northern hemisphere and the other in the Southern. – fact51 Source: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Zer%C3%A3o

Michelangelo was the third sculptor to work on the famous statue of David. The piece of Carrara marble itself is of mediocre quality, stood out in the elements for ~25 years, and was known as the Duccio stone before Michelangelo sculpted it into a masterpiece. – fact51Source: https://www.britannica.com/story/ten-days-that-vanished-the-switch-to-the-gregorian-calendar

India set a new world record planting over 66 million trees in 12 hours. The Madhya Pradesh state used 1.5 million volunteers to plant the saplings along the Narmada river. – fact51 Source: https://www.theyouth.in/2019/02/05/india-breaks-guinness-world-record-plants-66-million-trees-in-just-12-hours/
If you pick up two objects at the same time that have the same weight but are different sizes, the larger object will seem lighter. This phenomenon is known as the Size–Weight Illusion. – fact51

Fidel Castro, the Cuban dictator who died at age 90, slept with ~35,000 women, smoked his first cigar at age 14, and believed he survived nearly 600 assassination attempts. – fact51 Source: https://www.gq-magazine.co.uk/article/fidel-castro-quotes

People who work in silence are slower and less proficient than those who listen to music while working. Video game music itself is designed to keep you motivated and finishing tasks without stealing your focus. – fact51 Source: https://desktime.com/blog/why-you-should-listen-to-video-game-soundtracks-at-work

Pistachios split themselves open when they are ripe in a process called dehiscence. This trait has been selected and specifically cultivated with different varieties having various rates of dehiscence consistency. – fact51 Source: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pistachio#Botany

France passed a ‘right to disconnect’ law in 2017, allowing people to ignore emails that arrive outside business hours. – fact51Source: https://money.cnn.com/2017/01/02/technology/france-office-email-workers-law/index.html
